oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Randomized Complete Block Designs in Experimentation Science
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kratzer, Dal
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: data
experimentation science
experimental design
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Experimentation Science is defined as the science of making inferences from data generated for the purpose of input into the decision-making process. This talk will relate "Randomized Complete Blocks" as a valuable way of satisfying the requirements of experimentation science. Reliability is an essential property of data used in decision making. To achieve data that will provide reliable results, Experimentation Science requires the satisfaction of three R's: Relevance, Replication and Randomization.
